channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache MyFaces Core
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache MyFaces Core

item.title: CVE-2021-26296|2024-08-03T20:19:20.159Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20myfaces%20core
item.description: In the default configuration, Apache MyFaces Core versions 2.2.0 to 2.2.13, 2.3.0 to 2.3.7, 2.3-next-M1 to 2.3-next-M4, and 3.0.0-RC1 use cryptographically weak implicit and explicit cross-site request forgery (CSRF) tokens. Due to that limitation, it is possible (although difficult) for an attacker to calculate a future CSRF token value and to use that value to trick a user into executing unwanted actions on an application.
